  sgcool_label_text: This photograph shows a group of girls from Singapore Chinese Girls School and older women
 who may possibly be school teachers. \r\n\r\nSingapore Chinese Girls’ School was established on Hill Street in July 1899. Starting with a class of just seven students
 the school did not initially enjoy the support of senior members of the Peranakan community who did not believe in female education. Led by Lim Boon Keng and Song Ong Siang
 the group of younger Peranakans were determined to establish a school for girls which offered a modern curriculum based on Confucian values. \r\n

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a group of girls from Singapore Chinese Girls School and older women, who may possibly be school teachers. 

Singapore Chinese Girls’ School was established on Hill Street in July 1899. Starting with a class of just seven students, the school did not initially enjoy the support of senior members of the Peranakan community who did not believe in female education. Led by Lim Boon Keng and Song Ong Siang, the group of younger Peranakans were determined to establish a school for girls which offered a modern curriculum based on Confucian values.
